Router.name: Router

UI.name: UI
UI.description:
The UI class is the class for all user interface elements.
It is not directly used, but extended by many other classes.

View.name: View
View.description:
The View class handles each screen of the application. 
A list of views is specified in the applications options
and the files are loaded from the views/ folder.
Each view has a viewName.js and a viewName.html file.
The viewName.js file defines options for the view.

App.name: App
App.description: The App class defines the main object of the applications

params.name: options
params.description:
An object defining options for the application.
* views - An array with a list of view names

Context.description: Information about the context of the application (ej: device's viewport)

UIView.name: UIView
UIView.description: The UIView class is the UI representation of a view
UIView.author: Martín Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

View.name: View
View.description:
The View class handles each screen of the application. 
A list of views is specified in the applications options
and the files are loaded from the views/ folder.
Each view has a viewName.js and a viewName.html file.
The viewName.js file defines options for the view.

params.name: options
params.description:
An object defining options for the current view.
* constructor - A function that will be run after the view has loaded (optional).
* animation - a string defining the type of animation used to show this view (one of: "slide-left", "slide-right", "none").

View.author: Martín Szyszlican (martinsz [at] gmail.com)

classitems.description:
The application's version number
Note: It's not Mootor version, this value is defined in application code, not framework code.
classitems.name: version

classitems.description:
Stores the navigation history. 
An array of views, ordered in the sequence that they were visited by the user.
classitems.name: history

classitems.description:
The application's version number
Note: It's not Mootor version, this value is defined in application code, not framework code.
classitems.name: version

classitems.description:
Application settings
If called with a key, returns the value. If called with key and value, sets value to key.
classitems.name: settings

classitems.description: Go to the previous view in the history
classitems.name: back
app

params.name: views
params.description: A list of view names to be initialized

classitems.description: The URL regex referenced by this route
classitems.name: regex

classitems.description:
The view that implements this route
If called with no parameters, it returns the currently set view in this route.
classitems.name: view

params.name: view
params.description: - The view that implements this route

classitems.description: Shows element (not necesarily, since the element's parent might be hidden or out of view)
classitems.name: show

return.description: Serialized data in a JSON object

params.name: state
params.description: State of the input, true if disabled false if enabled

params.description: State of the input, true if disabled false if enabled

classitems.description: Sets an event handler for the input
classitems.name: on

params.name: event
params.description: Defines in which event the handler will be called

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to be called when the event is fired.

classitems.description:
Title
The text to display in the header
If called with no arguments returns the current title
classitems.name: title

params.name: show
params.description: Show or hide the loading indicator

classitems.description: Set the style for the loading animation
classitems.name: style

params.name: options
params.description: Style options TODO: Define this object's structure

classitems.description:
Move the element to the specified position inside the UIApp / m-views-container. 
If coordinates are not specified, it returns coordinates object with the current position.
classitems.name: position

params.name: transition
params.description: Transition type. MUST be one of: slide-left, slide-right, none

classitems.description: Init View instance, load HTML, CSS and JavaScript files for the view
classitems.name: _init

classitems.description:
Title is the friendly name for the current view.
When called without parameters, returns a string containing the title. When called with parameters, sets the title.
classitems.name: title

classitems.description:
Sets an event handler for the view
Possible values for event: load, beforeLoad, unload, beforeUnload, init
TODO: Define which parameters are passed to the callback function.
classitems.name: on

params.name: event
params.description: Defines in which event the handler will be called

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to be called when the event is fired.

classitems.description:
Unsets event handlers for the view
Possible values for event: load, beforeLoad, unload, beforeUnload, init
classitems.name: off

params.name: event
params.description: Defines in which event we want to unset handlers

params.name: callback
params.description: If this parameter is specified, only that function is removed. Otherwise all callbacks for this event are removed.

params.name: options
params.description: The options object for the view
